questions.text: Who gets bitten by a rattlesnake in the opening scene?
questions.explanation:
Barf Bag.

	Barf Bag purposefully lets the snake bite him so he can get away from Camp Green Lake.

a juvenile detention camp.

	There's no lake there, and nothing much that's green, either.

questions.text: What is the real reason for digging holes at Camp Green Lake?
questions.correct: The Warden is looking for buried treasure.
options: Digging holes turns bad boys good.
The Warden's pet lizards need homes.
questions.explanation:
The Warden is looking for buried treasure.

	All her life the Warden has been looking for Kissin' Kate Barlow's loot.

questions.text: Is Stanley's great-great-grandfather really a pig stealer?
questions.correct: No, but he breaks a promise to a fortune teller.
options: Yes, he steals two pigs from Morris Menke, his girlfriend's dad.
No, but he marries Myra Menke without her father's permission.
No, but he steals Madame Zeroni's treasure.
questions.explanation:
No, but he breaks a promise to a fortune teller.

	Elya Yelnats makes a deal (involving a pig and a pretty girl) with Madame Zeroni the fortune teller. Unfortunately, Elya is on a boat to America when he remembers that he forgot to fulfill his side of the bargain: carrying Madame Zeroni up a mountain to drink from a fountain-of-youth-type stream.

questions.text: What does Stanley's family history have to do with Camp Green Lake's history?
questions.correct: His great-grandfather was robbed by an outlaw from Green Lake, Texas.
options: His great-great-grandfather founded Green Lake, Texas, around 1885.
His family once owned the lake and most of the town of Green Lake, Texas.
His great-grandmother married the sheriff of Green Lake, Texas.
questions.explanation:
His great-grandfather was robbed by an outlaw from Green Lake, Texas.

	Stanley's great-grandpa, Stanley Yelnats the First, makes a fortune in the New York Stock Market. He loses his fortune to the outlaw Kissin' Kate Barlow when she robs the stagecoach he's on. Kate is Green Lake's former schoolteacher.

questions.text: In the movie (not in real life), which of these is most lethal?
questions.explanation:
a yellow-spotted lizard.

	If you are bitten by a yellow-spotted lizard, you ALWAYS die.

options: the Sheriff of Green Lake, Texas
questions.explanation:
Sam the Onion Man.

	Katherine and Sam fall in love while Sam makes a series of repairs to the schoolhouse. Sam is black, and it's 1905, so the townspeople don't approve. Trout Walker (a mean, rich man who's also sweet on Kate) sees the interracial couple kissing. He leads a mob that burns down the schoolhouse and murders poor Sam.

options: the outlaw who robs Stanley's ancestor
questions.explanation:
Sam's mule.

	Sam loves Mary Lou so much that he names his rowboat after her. A mob of townspeople shoot poor Mary Lou when they find out about Sam's romance with Katherine Barlow.

questions.text: Besides a fish fossil, what does Stanley find in one of his holes?
questions.explanation:
a lipstick tube.

	The tube once belonged to the outlaw Kissin' Kate Barlow. She wore lipstick so she could leave her trademark red smooch on victims' cheeks.

questions.text: What does Mr. Sir snack on?
questions.explanation:
sunflower seeds.

	He eats them because he quit smoking. By the end of the movie he starts smoking again.
